alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 18 at 6:45PM MDT until June 18 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 9 PM MDT MONDAY ACROSS WEST CENTRAL AND NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF NEW MEXICO AND THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, GUSTY WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry, and unstable conditions will continue through Monday. Breezy to locally windy west winds will combine with minimum relative humidity values in the low teens resulting in several hours of critical fire conditions for the northeast highlands and much of western New Mexico on Monday. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from noon to 9 PM MDT Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest at 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS..Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
